alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:25PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR WESTERN WICOMICO AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 522 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Breezy Point, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 5:18 PM EDT, an NWS employee reported golf ball sized hail in Calvert, Maryland. This storm also has a history of wind damage. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Taylors Island around 530 PM EDT. University Of Maryland Center For Environmental Studies around 540 PM EDT. Cambridge around 545 PM EDT. Secretary around 550 PM EDT. Vienna around 600 PM EDT. Sharptown around 605 PM EDT. Hebron around 610 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Galestown, Green Hill, Catchpenny, Wetipquin, Madison, Brookview, Trinity, Eldorado, Andrews and Royal Oak. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
